title: The Hidden Corridor
description: During a routine Service District utility inspection, a worker discovers a sealed passage beneath a noble house's service corridor. The passage extends for at least a hundred metres and ends in a locked iron door. The Ward Authority asks you to determine where the passage leads and whether it poses a security risk.

turns.narrative: The passage is clean and dry — not a sewer tunnel. The brickwork is Pre-Scourge quality and the passage has been maintained: no cobwebs, no dust, a faint smell of lantern oil. The locked iron door at the end bears the seal of the old Concordat Civil Service.
turns.choice_a: Force the door open to investigate what lies beyond
turns.consequence_a: Behind the door is a small chamber containing a map table and several sealed wooden boxes. The map shows a network of service passages beneath the entire noble quarter.
turns.choice_b: Return with Archive Researcher Winn before opening anything
turns.consequence_b: Winn identifies the door seal as belonging to the Pre-Scourge urban planning division. The passage is a legitimate infrastructure route.

turns.narrative: The boxes contain Pre-Scourge urban administrative records — property deeds, utility maps, and population surveys. Also included: a list of fifteen noble house lots that were never legally transferred from Concordat civil ownership, technically making them currently unowned under existing law.
turns.choice_a: Bring the ownership list to the Ward Legal Authority immediately
turns.consequence_a: A significant legal review is triggered. Several noble families receive letters questioning their property title.
turns.choice_b: Secure the documents in the Archive and let the legal question be handled through proper channels over time
turns.consequence_b: The documents are archived. The legal question exists but has no immediate urgency.

turns.narrative: The service passage network itself has significant practical uses for utility maintenance.
turns.choice_a: Recommend the passage network be mapped and formally incorporated into Service District infrastructure
turns.consequence_a: A mapping project begins. Several utility teams are already planning how to use the passages.
turns.choice_b: Recommend the passages remain sealed pending a security assessment
turns.consequence_b: The passages are re-sealed. The security assessment is scheduled.

legal_triggered.description: Ward Legal Authority reviewing noble property ownership.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Ward Legal Authority reviewing noble property ownership.
